result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Wertjes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay restitution to D.H. in the amount of $193.20 (to be paid in full first), G.H. & A.H. in the amount of $250.00 (to be paid in full first), Security Health Plan in the amount of $4,199.45 (to be paid in full second) and Progressive Insurance in the amount of $7,968.84 (to be paid in full second).  Parties stipulate that a check had been received in the amount of $6,306; the remaining balance of the restitution is to be paid within 12 months of the completion of the defendant's jail sentence on his other counts.
*Restitution summary to be filed.

*Pay costs
*DNA SURCHARGE NOT REQUESTED 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

*No contact with D.H.
*Write a letter of apology to D.H. within the next 30 days and provide to agent for approval and to forward if appropriate
*Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
*Participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent

(Count 2)

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement  (Count 1 - 36 months) (If the defendant complies with all of the conditions of this agreement, the strangulation charge pending against the defendant in this case will be amended to a Misdemeanor Battery and the defendant will serve a 6 months jail sentence concurrent with any other jail sentence imposed at the time of sentencing.

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF156, 15CF381, 17CF130 and 15CM172.

11:21 a.m.  Atty Molepske calls the case and states the appearances.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification but had provided victim impact statement(s) to the Court.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Ruby makes statements that Atty Renc was the attorney on 15CF381 and defendant is in approval of Atty Ruby completing the sentencing on these cases today.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF156:
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - No contest 

15CF381:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

17CF130:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM172:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court clarifies that victim had been given notification but does not appear in Court today.
Court questions the length of time for the Deferred Entry of Judgment being requested in the amount of 36 months; Atty Molepske makes statements on the record.
Atty Ruby makes his statements on the record regarding this issue.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF156, guilty on Count 3 of 15CF381 & Counts 1 & 2 are DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 17CF130 and guilty on Counts 3-5 on 15CM172.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Ruby makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

**Sentencing Clerk had discussions with fellow Clerk's in the office with regards to how the Information (had been changed so that both cases were included on one Information for the purpose of a Jury Trial) had been filed for cases 15CF156 and 15CM172 - 15CF156 had Count 1 and 15CM172 had Count's 2-5 which does not match the way the case had been initially filed, so further discussions with the Br 3 sentencing Judge it was determined that the easiest way to resolve this issue (clerk was not able to amend the Count's in 15CM172) was to dismiss Count's 1-4 in 15CM172 outright and then add Count's 2-5 to 15CF156.  Clerk updated the cases as per the discussion with Br 3 Judge.

Jury Trial - Day 2 
Exhibit #8 marked on behalf of the Plaintiff prior to Court calling the case. 

8:08 a.m.  Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Molepske addresses exhibits #6 & #7 with the Court.  Court has Exhibit #6 and what the clerk has as #7.  Those 2 exhibits are the exact same picture. 

Court understands the whiteboard is now working.  Court questions the parties. 

D.H. returns to the witness stand.  Court reminds her she is still under oath. 

Atty Molepske asks for a ruling from the Court re: testimony of the victims mother.  
Atty Ruby makes arguments to the Court.   
Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty Molepske responds.  Witness was added to the list on Monday. 
BY THE COURT:  If the state will be calling the victims mother, then she is not allowed to be in the courtroom.  

8:17 a.m.  Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
Cross exam by Atty Ruby.

Re-direct exam by Atty Molepske continues. 
8:50 a.m.  Re-cross exam by Atty Ruby. 
8:51 a.m.  Witness is excused and may remain in the courtroom. 


8:54 a.m.  A.H. is called and sworn.
Direct exam by Atty Molepske.
8:59 a.m.  Cross exam by Atty Ruby. 
9:00 a.m. Witness is excused. 

9:00 a.m.  Officer N. Schulfer is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Exhibit #9 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.  Referred to during testimony.
Exhibit #9 is opened and identified by the witness. 
Atty Molepske offers Exhibit #9.  
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #9 is received.

Atty Molepske moves for the admission of Exhibits #10 thru #17.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibits #10 thru #17 are received and published to the jury. 
Exhibit #18 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff. 
Atty Molepske moves for the admittion of Exhibit #18. 
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #18 is received and published to the jury. 
Exhibit #8 is referred to during testimony. 
Atty Molepske moves for the admission of Exhibit #8. 
Exhibit #8 is received. 
DVD is played from 
1:09:43 to 1:11:53

10:13 a.m.  Court takes a recess until 10:30 a.m. 
Court advises jurors not to discuss this case at this time. 

10:37 a.m.  Court is back in session outside the presence of the jury. 
Neither party needs to address the court at this time. 
Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
10:38 a.m.  Direct exam by Atty Molepske continues. 
DVD is played from 1:19:15 to 1:19:50
10:46 a.m.  Cross exam by Atty Ruby. 
Exhibit #19 is marked on behalf of the Defendant and referred to during testimony.
10:56 a.m.  Jurors are escorted from the Courtroom. 
Atty Ruby addresses the Court re: video. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #19 is received for impeachment purposes. 

10:59 a.m.  Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 
Cross exam continues by Atty Ruby. 
Playing video file number ending in 033 from: 
18:05:13 to 18:05:18
18:06:55 to 18:07:14
18:07:54 to 18:08:17
11:19 a.m.  Re-direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Exhibit #20 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff and referred to during testimony.
Exhibit #3 is referred to during testimony.
Atty Molepske moves for the admission of Exhibit #20. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #20 is received. 
11:33 a.m.  Re-cross exam by Atty Ruby. 
11:37 a.m.  2nd Re-direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
11:39 a.m.  Atty Ruby moves for the admission of exhibit #19. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #19 is received. 
11:40 a.m.  Jurors are escorted from the Courtroom. 
Court questions Atty Ruby. 
Defendant will testify. 
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant re: testifying. 

11:42 p.m. Jurors are escorted to the Courtroom. 

11:43 p.m.  T.W. is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Ruby. 

12:08 p.m.  Court advises the jury not to discuss the matter. 
Court takes it's lunch recess.  Parties are asked to be back as close to 1 as possible.  

1:07 p.m. Back on the record outside the jurors presence.  
DA makes a statement to the court re: length of trial.
1:08 p.m. Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  
1:11 p.m.  Witness takes the stand and court reminds him that he is still under oath.  Attorney Ruby continues with direct exam.   
1:29 p.m.  DA Molepske cross-examines the witness.  
1:42 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out so issues can be heard outside their presence.  
1:45 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.   DA continues with cross examination of witness.  
2:15 p.m.  Redirect by Attorney Ruby.  Defense rests.  2:17 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  Court advises jury to not discuss the case or start any deliberations.
2:41 p.m.  Court is back in session.  Court and attorneys work on the jury instructions. No objections to verdict form except for spelling of defendant.  3:25 p.m.  Court departs courtroom to make corrections on documents.
3:49 p.m.  Court is back in session.  All corrections were made and copies made of the corrections.  
3:52 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  Court gives instructions to the jurors.  
4:20 p.m.  DA Molepske gives closing argument.  4:34 p.m.  Attorney Ruby gives closing argument.  4:52 p.m.  Alternate juror is excused  2978.  Then court reads verdict forms to the jurors.  
4:56 p.m.  Oath of officers is given.  4:59 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court informs the attorneys of corrections made on the record when reading instructions to jurors.  DA states theres another correction is needed.  Corrections are made and all instructions are going to jurors at 5:18 p.m.  

7:40 p.m.  Court is back on the record and same appearances as prior.  There is a note from the jurors.  Court sends a note back asking if they were given more time by coming back tomorrow if an unanimous verdict could be reached.  

7:46 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  Verdict is handed to the court.  Court reads the verdicts.  
NG - intimidation, individually polled all stating yes
G - disorderly conduct, jurors individually polled
G - criminal damage to property, court individually polls the jurors. 
G - carrying concealed weapon, court individually polls the jurors.  

There is one count the jury was unable to reach a verdict indicating they are deadlocked.  Court thanks the jurors for their service.  Jurors are excused  7:50 p.m.  

State moves for judgment upon verdict.  Based on jury's verdict, court enters judgment of conviction on disorderly conduct, criminal damage to property and carrying concealed weapon.  The domestic surcharge does apply

A mistrial on the stragulation charge.  JA will contact the attorneys to schedule a status and sentencing hearing.  
Court Continues bond as previously set in this case. 
7:52 p.m. case is adjourned.

Day 1: 
8:30 a.m. Defendant Tyler Wertjes is present with Attorney Ruby. DA Louis Molepske for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in Chambers -  Motion on Limine placed on the record.
Court in session. Court welcomes potential Jurors. Clerk administers Voir Dire Oath. 23 potential jurors selected. Court administers Voir Dire. State admininisters Voir Dire. Defense administers Voir Dire. Parties exercise their peremptory strikes. 13 Jurors are selected (12 with 1 alternate).
11:30 a.m. Court thanks the juror that were not selected and are excused.
Clerk administers Jury Oath. Court gives opening instructions.
11:45 a.m. Court in recess for lunch, Jurors and Parties to be back by 12:50 p.m.

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court. Prosecuting Atty Louis John Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Cole Daniel Ruby appeared by phone for Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes.
Cases heard today are 15CF156 and 15CM172.
9:45 a.m. Court calls the case.  DA Molepske states the appearances.
Motion before the Court to join 15CF156 and 15CM172. 
DA Molepske states status for the record.
Atty Ruby does not object to the joining of the two files.

BY THE COURT:

Motion for Joinder is granted for cases 15CF156 and 15CM172.
Bond is to continue.
for Joinder filed by ADA E.C.
Motion hearing on November 18, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial on December 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby and Anne Renc. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF156, 15CM172 (Atty Ruby), 15CF381 (Atty Renc)
3:27 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Constable states the appearances. 
Victim is present in Court. 

Atty Constable makes statements re: objection to an adjournment by both defense counsels. 
Atty Ruby addresses the Court re: the request for adjournment.  Defendant has entered treatment. 
Court questions Atty Ruby. 
Atty Renc addresses the Court re: joining in the request for adjournment. 
Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court against adjournment. 
Atty Ruby makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Constable states she is revoking the plea offer for the reasons stated on the record and requesting a jury trial on the matters. 
Atty Ruby makes statements to the Court.  Was not given advance notice of the withdrawn offer.

Court notes the oldest file will be heard first.  Reviews the files.  Notes the CF cases have the same offense date.  Questions if the matters should be heard together. 
Atty Constable indicates the CF matters would be appropriate to try together.  State will file a motion for joinder. 

BY THE COURT:  
15CF156 & 15CM172 to be set for jury trial. 
15CF381 is to be set for a status conference on that date.

Atty Ruby questions the court re: scheduling a final pre-trial or status conference.  Asks for a status conference a couple of weeks ahead of time.  Make that the date that there will be no more plea negotiations. 

Court advises Atty Constable to be sure the DA speaks with the victim re: any resolutions. 
Atty Constable states she has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  
  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
letter from Atty Cole D Ruby dated 08/10/16 in re:  request to continue the plea/sentencing set for 08/30/16
Telephone scheduling conference on August 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.
VACATED
Pre-trial conference at 03-14-2016 09:15 am

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *D.H. her residence or her place of employment or any place temporarily occupied by her*   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby. Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in custody. Elizabeth Counstable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-156 and 15CM-172.

11:19 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Constable addresses the Court regarding expunction. State requests that Count 2 in 15CM-172 to be reopened.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Court takes a moment to review the file.

11:29 AM 15CM-172 has been brought in.

When plea agreement was reached, Defense counsel told Defendant that he would be eligible for expungement. Due to age, Court did not grant the expungement. On a post conviciton motion, there is a request to withdraw pleas to ineffective assistance of counsel. State does not object to vacating JOC and staring over again.

There has been new plea negotiations.

Atty Constable addresses the Court.

15CF-156: Defendant will plead to charge.

15CM-172: Defendant will plead to all 4 counts.

Atty Ruby concurs.
Court did receive victim impact statements at the last hearing.

Atty Ruby did prepare new Plea questionnaire/Agreements.

Court will not go along with the plea agreement that the State has stated on the record.

Court suggests a trial.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, suggests a pretrial date to be set.

BY THE COURT:
Based on the uncontested motion for postconviction relief, that being that Defendant did not knowingly voluntarily enter his plea. Court will allow Defendant to withdraw pleas in both files, 15CF-156 and 15CM-172 and Judgment of Convictions are Vacated. Plea agreement announced will not be accepted by the Court. 

Atty Ruby believes a pretrial date will be appropriate.

State addresses bond.
15CF-156 had a signature bond. 
15CM-172 did not have a bond.

Victim was notified of today's hearing.

Atty Ruby addresses the Court.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 11:00 am

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler J. Wertjes in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF156, 15CM172

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lloyd makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
15CF156 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
No contact with Diana Helminiak, direct or indirect. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Get all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so agent can monitor healthcare, mental healthcare and prescription medication. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Engage in any other counseling, treatment or assessments that may be deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Pay restitution of $12,418.29 at a minimum of $300 per month.  Pay more if able. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Serve 300 days jail. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 30 days.   
Entire sentence to be served in the jail.  Electronic Monitoring is denied. 
Can be served in Juneau county or any county he has employment, if they accept him. 
Must report today for start date and time. 

15CM172 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent with all other probations: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF156. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM172 Count 3 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF156. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM172 Count 4 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF156. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Court addresses expungment at this time.  
Questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court finds the defendant is not eligible for expungment for the reasons stated on the record. 
Court advises post-conviction. 

Both parties will retain the PSI copies confidentially in their files.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim was given notification and is in the Courtroom today and would like to make a victim impact statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF156 and guilty on Count 1, 3 & 4 of 15CM172 and Count 2 of 15CM172 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
